across.text: Religious claim is thrown out
across.explanation: ISLAMIC(i.e. “religious”). “Thrown out” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of CLAIM IS.

across.text: Where one may find hot spices – hot not cold – readily
across.explanation: IN A HURRY(i.e. “readily”). Solution is IN A CURRY (i.e. “where one may find hot spices” – nom, nom, nom!) with the C replaced by H (indicated by “hot not cold” – H being a recognised abbreviation of “hot”, C “cold”), like so: IN-A-(C)URRY => IN-A-(H)URRY.

across.text: Weaken one politician with broadcast
across.explanation: IMPAIR(i.e. “weaken”). Solution is I (i.e. “[Roman numeral] one”) followed by MP (i.e. “politician”, specifically a Member of Parliament) and AIR (i.e. to “broadcast”).

across.text: What leads to colours in fall? Crown cover around New York has northeast eclipsing south
across.explanation: TRIPHENYLMETHANE(i.e. “what leads to colours” – the stuff is used in the making of dyes). Solution is TRIP (i.e. “fall”) followed by HELMET (i.e. “crown cover”, specifically the crown of one’s head) once wrapped around NY (a recognised abbreviation of “New York”), then HAS once the S has been replaced by NE (indicated by “northeast eclipsing south” – NE being a recognised abbreviation of “northeast”; S “south”), like so: TRIP-HE(NY)LMET-HA(S) => TRIP-HE(NY)LMET-HA(NE).

across.text: Hearing organ’s part in tango make sweet backing
across.explanation: TRAGUS(i.e. “hearing organ’s part”). Solution is T (“tango” in the phonetic alphabet) followed by SUGAR (i.e. “sweet”) once reversed (indicated by “backing”), like so: T-RAGUS. One nailed from the wordplay and a shufti in Chambers.

across.text: Rascal with Irish accent, not British
across.explanation: ROGUE(i.e. “rascal”). Solution is BROGUE (i.e. “Irish accent”) with the B removed (indicated by “not British” – B being a recognised abbreviation of “British”).

across.text: Managed most of palace retinue’s resentment
across.explanation: RANCOUR(i.e. “resentment”). Solution is RAN (i.e. “managed”) followed by COURT (i.e. “palace’s retinue”) once its last letter has been removed (indicated by “most of”), like so: RAN-COUR.

across.text: One only separating in Louisiana to annoy Louis XIV
across.explanation: ROI SOLEIL(i.e. “Louis XIV”, aka the Sun King). Solution is I (i.e. “[Roman numeral] one”) and SOLE (i.e. “only”) both placed “in” ROIL (i.e. “in Louisiana to annoy”, as in how the word is more of an Americanism), like so: RO(I-SOLE)IL.

across.text: Bury Malian unclothed among other things
across.explanation: INTER ALIA(i.e. “among other things”). Solution is INTER (i.e. to “bury”) followed by ALIA (i.e. “Malian unclothed”, i.e. the word “Malian” with its first and last letter removed).

across.text: Current EU politician getting round popular old chancellor
across.explanation: IMHOTEP(i.e. “old chancellor” in ancient Egypt). Solution is I (a recognised abbreviation of an electric “current” used in physics) followed by MEP (i.e. “EU politician”, specifically a Member of the European Parliament) once wrapped “round” HOT (i.e. “popular”), like so: I-M(HOT)EP. Did I get this one fromThe Mummyfilms? Mayyyyyyyyybe…

across.text: Playwright capturing all the rage about mad cow disease
across.explanation: HenrikIBSEN(i.e. “playwright”). Solution is IN (i.e. “all the rage”) once wrapped “about” BSE (i.e. bovine spongiform encephalopathy, more commonly known as “mad cow disease”), like so: I(BSE)N.

across.text: After a change to the final ordering, goes out live
across.explanation: EXIST(i.e. “live”). Solution is EXITS (i.e. “goes out”) “after a change to the final ordering”, specifically the last two letters.

across.text: Typical EU out of control – they have branches in Australia
across.explanation: EUCALYPTI(i.e. “they have branches in Australia”). “Out of control” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of EU TYPICAL.

across.text: Hertfordshire village a short way east of railway
across.explanation: ELSTREE(i.e. “Hertfordshire village”). Solution is STREET (i.e. “way”) with its last letter removed (indicated by “short”) and the remainder placed after or “east of” – this being an across clue – EL (i.e. “railway”, specifically an informal reference to an elevated railway over in the US), like so: EL-STREE.

across.text: Dog – retired always going after right one
across.explanation: RETRIEVER(i.e. “dog”). Solution is RET (a recognised abbreviation of “retired”) and EVER (i.e. “always”) once the latter has been placed “after” R (a recognised abbreviation of “right”) and I (i.e. “[Roman numeral] one”), like so: RET-(R-I)-EVER.

across.text: Check bank document’s replacement
across.explanation: REINSTATEMENT(i.e. “replacement”). Solution is REIN (i.e. to stem or “check”) followed by STATEMENT (i.e. “bank document”).

across.text: Still show nave vault a bit damaged
across.explanation: TABLEAU VIVANT(i.e. a living picture or “still show”, often depicting a historic scene). “Damaged” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of NAVE VAULT A BIT.

across.text: Work on and off switch for siren
across.explanation: TEMPTRESS(i.e. “siren”). Solution is TEMP (i.e. to “work on and off”) followed by TRESS (i.e. “switch”, or a false lock of hair).

across.text: Note falsehoods going about like false names
across.explanation: ALIASES(i.e. “false names”). Solution is A (i.e. “[musical] note”) followed by LIES (i.e. “falsehoods”) once wrapped “about” AS (i.e. akin to or “like”), like so: A-LI(AS)ES.

across.text: Civil engineer needs resistance in a soil to settle
across.explanation: ASCERTAIN(i.e. “to settle”). Solution is CE (a recognised abbreviation of “civil engineer”) and R (a recognised abbreviation of “resistance”) both placed “in” A and STAIN (i.e. to “soil”), like so: A-S(CE-R)TAIN.

across.text: Make amends towards an individual
across.explanation: ATONE(i.e. “make amends”). When written as AT ONE the solution also satisfies “towards an individual”).

across.text: Woollen footwear perhaps is striking
across.explanation: SOCKS. Solution satisfies “woollen footwear perhaps” and “is striking”.

across.text: Son Tommy upset about papa’s sign of disease
across.explanation: SYMPTOM(i.e. “sign of disease”). Solution is S (a recognised abbreviation of “son”) followed by an anagram (indicated by “upset”) of TOMMY once wrapped “about” P (“papa” in the phonetic alphabet), like so: S-YM(P)TOM.

across.text: Thrilled about a ram for religious ritual
across.explanation: SACRAMENT(i.e. “religious ritual”). Solution is SENT (i.e. “thrilled” – one of the definitions of “send” is “(orig of jazz) to rouse (someone) to ecstasy”(Chambers)) wrapped “about” A and CRAM (i.e. to stuff or “ram”), like so: S(A-CRAM)ENT.

across.text: Point to a missile advanced across river bank
across.explanation: ARROWHEAD(i.e. “point to a missile”). Solution is AHEAD (i.e. “advanced”) wrapped around or placed “across” R (a recognised abbreviation of “river”) and ROW (i.e. a line or “bank”), like so: A(R-ROW)HEAD.

across.text: A very dishonourable man in the centre of Wood Green
across.explanation: AVOCADO(i.e. a “green” colour). Solution is A followed by V (a recognised abbreviation of “very”) and CAD (i.e. “dishonourable man”) once placed “in” OO (i.e. “centre [letters] of wood”), like so: A-V-O(CAD)O.

across.text: Old Mexican investigator chasing a final letter
across.explanation: AZTEC(i.e. “old Mexican”). Solution is TEC (i.e. “investigator”, specifically a shortened form of “detective”) placed after or “chasing” A and Z (i.e. “final letter”), like so: (A-Z)-TEC.

across.text: Inflammation is rife in tissue in spleen, primarily
across.explanation: IRITIS(i.e. “inflammation” of the iris). “Primarily” indicates the solution is derived from the initial letters ofIsRifeInTissueInSpleen.

across.text: Plant type of breakfast perhaps coming from Asia to Europe
across.explanation: INTERCONTINENTAL(i.e. “perhaps coming from Asia to Europe”). Solution is INTER (i.e. to bury or “plant”) followed by CONTINENTAL (i.e. “type of breakfast”).

across.text: What fool called Lear’s sister and called regularly
across.explanation: NUNCLE(i.e. “what fool called Lear”, apparently a contraction of “mine uncle”). Solution is NUN (i.e. “sister”) followed by CLE (i.e. “called regularly”, i.e. every other letter ofCALLED).

across.text: No saint – certainly Romeo, though this one might deny it
across.explanation: NAYSAYER(i.e. “this one might deny it”). Solution is NAY (i.e. “no”) followed by S (a recognised abbreviation of “saint”), then AYE (i.e. “certainly”) and R (“Romeo” in the phonetic alphabet).

across.text: Tubercular university lecturer returning with a lot of fat
across.explanation: NODULAR(i.e. “tubercular”). Solution is U (a recognised abbreviation of “university”) followed by DON (i.e. “lecturer”) all reversed (indicated by “returning”) and followed by LARD (i.e. “fat”) once its last letter has been removed (indicated by “a lot of…”), like so: (NOD-U)-LAR.

down.text: Written avoiding rules? Trainee penning lie mostly needs attention
down.explanation: INTERLINEAR(i.e. “written avoiding rules” – as in ruled lines on paper). Solution is INTERN (i.e. “trainee”) wrapped around or “penning” LIE once its last letter has been removed (indicated by “mostly”) and followed by EAR (i.e. “attention”), like so: INTER(LI)N-EAR.

down.text: Remaining airlines’ business losing following
down.explanation: LYING(i.e. “remaining”). Solution is FLYING (i.e. “airlines’ business”) once the F has been removed (indicated by “losing following” – F being a recognised abbreviation of “following”).

down.text: Preserved meat given up by one who can tell the future is fish
down.explanation: MAHSEER(i.e. “fish”). Solution is HAM (i.e. “preserved meat”) reversed (indicated by “given up” – this being a down clue) and followed by SEER (i.e. “one who can tell the future”), like so: MAH-SEER. Another nailed from the wordplay.

down.text: Principal uneasy over scheme, something governing body moves
down.explanation: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM(i.e. “something governing body moves”). Solution is CENTRAL (i.e. “principal”) followed by NERVOUS (i.e. “uneasy”) and SYSTEM (i.e. “scheme”).

down.text: Cardinal’s twiddling a sort of chain
down.explanation: ISLAND ARC(i.e. “sort of chain”, as in the geographic feature). “Twiddling” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of CARDINAL’S.

down.text: Attacked caterpillar always will escape the onset initially
down.explanation: AWETO(i.e. “attacked caterpillar”, supposedly one infected with a parasitic fungus and destined to be used as a pigment. Poor little bugger). “Initially” indicates the solution is derived from the first letters ofAlwaysWillEscapeTheOnset. Another nailed solely from the wordplay. Interesting though.

down.text: I shush rep being unruly in director’s office
down.explanation: USHERSHIP(i.e. “director’s office”). “Being unruly” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of I SHUSH REP.

down.text: Potato disease resistance in being acquired protects tuber finally
down.explanation: RING ROT(i.e. “potato disease”). Solution is R (a recognised abbreviation of “resistance”) followed by IN, then GOT (i.e. “acquired”) once wrapped around or “protecting” R (i.e. “tuber finally”, i.e. the last letter of “tuber”), like so: R-IN-G(R)OT.

down.text: Inventor surrounded by old stuff set up
down.explanation: GuglielmoMARCONI(i.e. “inventor”). Solution is IN (i.e. “surrounded by”) followed by O (a recognised abbreviation of “old”) and CRAM (i.e. to “stuff”) all reversed (indicated by “set up” – this being a down clue), like so: MARC-O-NI.

down.text: Gross rage is out of order for assailant
down.explanation: AGGRESSOR(i.e. “assailant”). “Is out of order” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of GROSS RAGE.

down.text: Brilliant place to finish in here, avoiding pressure
down.explanation: RESPLENDENT(i.e. “brilliant”). Solution is PL (a recognised abbreviation of “place”) and END (i.e. “to finish”) both placed “in” PRESENT (i.e. “here”) once the P has been removed (indicated by “avoiding pressure” – P being a recognised abbreviation of “pressure”), like so: RES(PL-END)ENT.

down.text: Clear damage on electronic component with direct oscillation
down.explanation: SIMPLE HARMONIC MOTION(i.e. “oscillation”). Solution is SIMPLE (i.e. “clear”) followed by HARM (i.e. “damage”), then ON, then IC (i.e. “electronic component”, specifically a recognised abbreviation of an Integrated Circuit), then MOTION (i.e. to gesture or “direct”).

down.text: Time to acquire? Save up for washing machine
down.explanation: TWIN-TUB(i.e. “washing machine”). Solution is T (a recognised abbreviation of “time”) followed by WIN (i.e. “to acquire”) and BUT (i.e. except for or “save”) once reversed (indicated by “up” – this being a down clue).

down.text: Balkan region once badly run with imam regularly ignored
down.explanation: ILLYRIA(i.e. “Balkan region once”). Solution is ILLY (i.e. “badly”) followed by R (a recognised abbreviation of “run” used in a number of ball games) and IA (i.e. “imam regularly ignored”, i.e. every other letter ofIMAM).

down.text: Falls around church? It can put one’s arm out
down.explanation: TRICEPS(i.e. a muscle that “can put one’s arm out”). Solution is TRIPS (i.e. “falls”) wrapped “around” CE (i.e. “church”, specifically the Church of England), like so: TRI(CE)PS.

down.text: Included map showing home station
down.explanation: INSET(i.e. “included map”). Solution is IN (i.e. at “home”) followed by SET (i.e. to place or “station”).

down.text: Carpets woven in ranges of colour
down.explanation: SPECTRA(i.e. “ranges of colour”). “Woven” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of CARPETS. Nicely played.

down.text: Indian dish of husked bran with fat
down.explanation: RAITA(i.e. “Indian dish” – the fifth time in just over a year that this has appeared in Jumbo cryptics. I’ve ranted about the prevalence of this solution before, obviously to no avail. Maybe I’m missing something here. Maybe this is a Derren Brown thing that Times setters are all in on. Maybe you are being softened up for some unnecessarily dangerous magic show based entirely around veggie yoghurt-based dishes. I’d pay attention this next week or two if I was you. If every busker you walk past is clunkily working “raita” into their lyrics, or you start seeing RAITA!!! subliminally flash on the screen duringGogglebox, or if you wake up one morning to find the word RAITA has been written backwards across your forehead, don’t be surprised. And if that does happen and you find yourself starring in the next Derren Brown TV special, imperilled by raita in some way, just remember I bloody well told you so). “Husked” indicates the solution is derived by removing the first and last letters of BRAN WITH FAT.

down.text: Fit to grasp English acting
down.explanation: INTERIM(i.e. “acting”). Solution is IN TRIM (i.e. “fit”) wrapped around or “grasping” E (a recognised abbreviation of “English”), like so: IN-T(E)RIM.

down.text: Perhaps blight turned some of the rose yellow
down.explanation: EYESORE(i.e. “perhaps blight”). “Some” indicates the solution has been hidden in the clue, while “turned” indicates the solution has been reversed, like so: TH(E ROSE YE)LLOW.

down.text: An exchange of words travelling on last train
down.explanation: TRANSLATION(i.e. “an exchange of words” from one language to another). “Travelling” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of ON LAST TRAIN.

down.text: Grand mushrooms rising broad and flat, billions must be about
down.explanation: SPECTACULAR(i.e. “grand”). Solution is CEPS (i.e. “mushrooms”) reversed (indicated by “rising” – this being a down clue) and followed by TABULAR (i.e. “broad and flat”) once the B (a recognised abbreviation of “billions”) has been replaced by C (i.e. “about”, specifically a recognised abbreviation of “circa”), like so: SPEC-TA(B)ULAR => SPEC-TA(C)ULAR.

down.text: Raid home with dogs inside having eaten nought
down.explanation: INCURSION(i.e. “raid”). Solution IN (i.e. at “home”) followed by CURS (i.e. “dogs”), then IN (i.e. “inside”) once wrapped around or “having eaten” O (i.e. “nought”), like so: IN-CURS-I(O)N.

down.text: Round to harvest green buds
down.explanation: CUT CAPERS(i.e. to gambol or “bound” – a new one on me). Solution is CUT (i.e. “to harvest”) followed by CAPERS (i.e. “green buds” used in cuisine). A nod to my Bradford’s for getting CAPERS. I couldn’t make the connection.

down.text: Rain beats violently, but one’s staying dry
down.explanation: ABSTAINER(i.e. “one’s staying dry” of alcohol). “Violently” indicates anagram. Solution is an anagram of RAIN BEATS.

down.text: Noticed millions doing evil in place of deal making?
down.explanation: SAWMILL(i.e. “place of deal making” – one of the variant meanings of “deal” is “a fir or pine board of a standard size”(Chambers). I’ve a feeling we’ve had this one before). Solution is SAW (i.e. “noticed”) followed by M (a recognised abbreviation of “millions”) and ILL (i.e. “evil”).

down.text: Fanatical about knight with a female to worship
down.explanation: MADONNA(i.e. “female to worship”). Solution is MAD ON (i.e. “fanatical about”) followed by N (a recognised abbreviation of “knight” used in chess), then A.

down.text: Spider scuttled to end up under article
down.explanation: ARANEID(i.e. a “spider”). Solution is RAN (i.e. “scuttled”) followed by DIE (i.e. “to end”) reversed (indicated by “up” – this being a down clue). These are then placed after or “under” (again, down clue) A (i.e. “article”, i.e. a word like a, an or the), like so: A-(RAN-EID).

down.text: Female novelist, note, unknown years after men
down.explanation: Baroness Emma (and about 20 middle names)ORCZY(i.e. “female novelist” who gave usThe Scarlet Pimpernel). Solution is C (i.e. “[musical] note”) followed by Z (i.e. “unknown” – setters love referring to X, Y or Z in solutions as unknowns) and Y (a recognised abbreviation of “years”). These are then all placed “after” OR (i.e. “men”, specifically the Other Ranks of the British Army), like so: OR-(C-Z-Y).

down.text: Measure a line integral
down.explanation: TOTAL(i.e. “integral”). Solution is TOT (i.e. “measure”) followed by A and L (a recognised abbreviation of “line”).
